website_summaries.verdict: Mechanix Wear tactical gloves offer the perfect combination of grip and protection.
pros: A good amount of protection and padding around the knuckles but fingers remain flexible enough for delicate tasks
cons: The gloves will need to be broken in a bit in order to get the most amount of flexibility

customer_reviews.title: FRAUD - Cheap Chinese bootleg
customer_reviews.text: FRAUD - CHEAP VINYL CHINESE BOOTLEG - YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!! These are NOT Mechanix Wear gloves. Heck, "Mechanix" is mispelled two different ways and IMPACT is spelled MPACT. Horrid build. You could easily pull the fingers right off. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Your Personal Warlock

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Bought for liggt duty stuff like range tine and beer drankin. They are awesome, fit well and padding is in perfect place. 2 month Update: after light duty stuff (changing light bulbs, splitting a few log) they are showing SIGNIFICANT wear and wont make it to summer. Probably will not buy again due to quality lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Steven foster

customer_reviews.title: Tough and versitile
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of these gloves. We had the first set for over two years and wore them down along with the dog finally getting ahold of them. We use them mainly for yard work, we have a lot of plants for thorns and a yard full of rock. They stand up nicely to getting wet in mud, moving rock around with your hands, and creates a nice barrier for the thorns on the lemon tree. They are comfortable, well made, and protective. Definitely recommend, just keep them away from chewing dogs, for that, they are no match!
customer_reviews.author: K. Post

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves. NOT TOUCH SCREEN COMPATIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for mountain biking. They are solid and well made. They are comfortable and fit well. The downside is that they are NOT touch screen capable like advertised. This makes it a huge pain in the a**! Every time I want to take a picture, answer a call, change a song or operate my bike app, I have to stop, take off my glove, stow it, use my phone, then dig the glove back out, put it on and fasten it. The index finger tip is too thick to use a touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: Steve.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely strong chemical smell and wears skin off knuckles
customer_reviews.text: Has a horrible toxic chemical smell that cannot be gotten rid of tried several different things but the smell is still there and they wear on the skin of your knuckles gloves to protect your hands not cause injury
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorites...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: These are the best fitting work gloves I've ever used. I typically hate wearing work gloves, but these don't diminish my feeling and dexterity nearly as much as other gloves. For me, these gloves are warm enough for mildly freezing temperatures as long as my hands stay dry. I typically run hot, though. Cons: I with the thumb and index fingers had the same box-type construction as the other fingers, but that is my only complaint regarding the fit. Also, these may not be the most durable gloves for serious work, but I can wear a finger hole in any work glove out there!
customer_reviews.author: Oasky

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves great quality, durable. Feels great comfortable and your hands don’t get too hot
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gloves for shooting or for combat. Very comfortable nice padding on the knuckles. Able to use touchscreen but it’s a little difficult. Even with my broken pinky that’s bent at 90° I’m able to get my hand in the glove it’s just a little hard with that issue. But these are the best gloves I’ve had and would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Dabloesco

customer_reviews.title: Protection at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Love the comfort and fit of the glove. Although i spent 22yrs in the us army 18B. I did not buy these gloves for tactical purposes. I am now a professional heavy truck tech and use them to protect my hands when i mount and dismount tires on the trucks. They do a wonderful job of keeping my hands from geeting banged up. For the price cant go wrong compared to higher priced similar type gloves from off the truck..! My tool box will have a extra set as well as my cart.
customer_reviews.author: Jrube

customer_reviews.title: They're warm, but not too warm, gloves that are durable and fit better over time and come with solid padding to absorb shock
customer_reviews.text: They're durable, nicely-padded gloves that keep my fingers warm in high 30, low 40 degree faranheit weather up in the Sierras where I live and bike. I have fairly long, but no very large/thick hands - until I washed these gloves and got them very wet and got them to dry did they eventually lengthen out a bit. At first, I felt like my knuckles were held a little uncomfortably light by the fabric and plastic/rubber synthetic armor. Happy with my purchase and I've put these gloves through some serious abuse and about 300 miles of singletrack and downhill with water and snow and mud spraying on them.
customer_reviews.author: m0arpheus

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, comfortable and great value.
customer_reviews.text: Best gloves I habe used, this is my second pair just to have a spare in my truck. I have owned a pair for over a year and I love them, super comfortable and they take a beating, use them on the field and compared to my friends no name gloves, these are unmatched. Leather is sturdy, stitches are holding up and they breathe pretty good. Knuckle protection is barely there but I don’t need it really.
customer_reviews.author: d4

customer_reviews.title: These for under $20 were a steal and have held up great in the first couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of oakley tactical gloves i bought off Oakley Standard Issue that had the seam on the wrist break on both gloves the first day. The oakley gloves, at a discount were $42, These for under $20 were a steal and have held up great in the first couple weeks. Theyre comfortable, durable, have some stretch to them and are legitimate OCP cammo. Smelled a little funky, some sort of manufacturing fumes but after a wash they were fine. Would reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Probably punchable, almost certainly durable
customer_reviews.text: Used enough and liked sufficiently that they're in my coat pocket (that I'm wearing) currently. Warm enough if you're moving or otherwise bundled up enough to be used for hunting in very cold to extreme conditions. Have worn in temperatures below zero (not including windchill) and were satisfactory but not fantastic. I mean, they're $25 or less, and for the price a very good value. Not quite dextrous enough that they're great for phones, but that'll do pig, that'll do. Haven't punched anyone with them on yet, but they'd probably work pretty well for that too.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Alright gloves...
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used a “touch screen” with these yet so not sure how well they would work with that. The palm and finger pads hold up great, but the top thinner material doesn’t hold up very well. Worn twice and they started falling apart on the top seams in the fingers. Overall good fit and not super stiff. They still do what they are supposed to do!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfy protective gloves, the iPhone finger and thumb work awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great looking gloves and the touch finger/thumb work perfectly. I bought them as protection for onewheeling and skateboarding with the dog and they are great. They made it to about mid may here in Louisiana and then it's abit warm to wear them so I bought some similar that are fingerless. I am very pleased with this purchase, they look really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Salvetti

customer_reviews.title: Impressive glove
customer_reviews.text: I was really debating on getting these because I couldn’t decide on the color scheme. I actually really wanted the Oakley Tactical gloves but just couldn’t justify the spend. I never have to again...I will now continue to only buy these gloves. Awesome tactical gloves with solid protection all around. The color scheme is toned down in person and it’s just a great glove, must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Almost great
customer_reviews.text: Almost great gloves but the finger tips are a little short for me (maybe I just have long fingers) and the gloves are a bit stiff for shooting. I wanted these gloves specifically for shooting but the stiffness and short fingertips take away finger dexterity deeming them not great shooting gloves. With that being said, I will continue to wear them hoping they will break-in more and become more fitting (still doubt I’ll shoot in them because the material is so stiff and non form fitting enough.
customer_reviews.author: fig

customer_reviews.title: Good fit. They are a little stiff at first ...
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. They are a little stiff at first but break in quickly. They have a really strong smell and it's not a good one. The finger material isn't very thick and I feel like if I wear them to work they would get trashed but for using my crutches they are good and the padding is in the right spot. They would also be good for mtn biking. I would rate them higher if they didn't smell and if the fingers were touch screen compatible. I feel at this price ($26) they should be tech friendly.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ray

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty sure these are knock offs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a previous pair that were starting to wear out. The first thing I noticed, was that they fit looser than my other pair. The wrist straps are not as sturdy and the seams are coming out after a few weeks. They definitely don't work with my phone's touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and poor fit.
customer_reviews.text: The set I received must have been a Friday pair because the fit was terrible. I've started buying a size smaller with this brand to maintain dexterity. If you can, its better to find a local dealer so you can try them on as no two pairs are the same fit.
customer_reviews.author: Riding Rails

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold up if using for manual work.
customer_reviews.text: Less than 4 months after purchasing these gloves, not only do I have a whole in the back of the right glove, but the seem has burst on one of my left fingers. Very annoying. And it's impossible to wash the stink out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul-Wayne Mahlow

customer_reviews.title: A great pair of gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have had these gloves for 2-3 years now and love them still. I've used them for rappelling, shooting, chainsaw/work use, and general use when it was cold. They have handled everything I have thrown at them with only moderate-minor wear on the finger seams. I will be buying more when these finally do run out. I think that says enough.
customer_reviews.author: Weston Cecil

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars  Good globes for your outdoors !!
customer_reviews.text: The Globes fit perfectly!! I don't think it is a 5-star product. Feels great in the hand. I pretty much use them all the time and I get lots of great comments overall. I can see little bit wear and tear, I've been using them for over a year now. Depends on what you do for a living, I don;t think these globed will work for extra heavy duty, but will definitely will save you skin in the hand. It's a buy!!
customer_reviews.author: E.W.W Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use in my Jeep for my recovery kit. They are nice and comfortable and seem to offer good protection. They do stink when you get them but it fades in a week or so and then they're good.
customer_reviews.author: VVBulldog

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Not very good for shooting gloves but amazing work gloves. Especially for briars across the back of the hand or knuckles. Cleared land for 1 summer using these and never got a briar in the knuckle of back of the hand. Now for the palm it's a different story.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Second pair
customer_reviews.text: Told the wife I needed these in the house, but really they’re my duty/shooting gloves. I own a black pair, but I wanted something different. For the money Mechanix impact are awesome. Forget $150 tactical gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves to use for moving as well
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are fully padded from your fingers to your knuckles. I use these as living gloves and my hand gets jammed in doorways all the time. I never feel anything because the paint completely protects my hand and fingers. If you sweat alot it will become moist. Other than that this product is great. I even bought a 2nd set!
customer_reviews.author: X.Brightly

customer_reviews.title: They fit and worked great, but then they frayed and fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I loved these gloves, but the 3rd of 4th time I used them, they fell apart. The pointer finger part of the gloves frayed extremely badly. What were gloves are now just a pile of thread. These things aren't worth $5.
customer_reviews.author: oconnorz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I shoot hundreds of pistols on a daily basis and these gloves hold up for months. I do cut off the thumbs and pointer fingers for feel and movement purposes. The price isnt bad but for as often as I buy them I wish they were a little cheaper. These gloves reduced the pain in my palms and wrists from shooting. I will be buying these for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Online just isn’t the same
customer_reviews.text: Not even week of use. Pad on left palm came off. Bought these gloves from store before and lasted long time. Online just not same
customer_reviews.author: Long

customer_reviews.title: Smelly but great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: It runs a little smaller than I expected. The rubber smells horrendous. The padding on the knuckles I wish was a tiny bit harder but it still gets the job done. I hope they last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves
customer_reviews.text: They are very well constructed and do a great job of keeping my hands warm. I bought them with the intention of using them as shooting gloves and it's hard to manipulate the controls of my pistols without modifications like a oversized magazine release. With my rifles I haven't noticed a problem like that. But I did lose some feeling on the trigger while wearing as well.
customer_reviews.author: GMoney

customer_reviews.title: spot on
customer_reviews.text: I love mine. Perfect fit (read their size chart/ do not guess) and I can use it to ride motorcycles, go backpacking, and just stay warm on a cold morning drive in my van to the studio. I can "function" without having to remove the glovees each time I need to pick something up.
customer_reviews.author: Marc C. Waszkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Horribly Uncomfortable. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic/rubber that protects the outside of your fingers has a lip that wraps into the inside into the tips of the fingers and is sharp. This is a blatant design flaw. Do not buy these. Horribly uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz Wylder

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the pilots green nomex ones I used in ...
customer_reviews.text: Well where to start? I have had these gloves for three years now and they have finally worn out.Hunting, range time and working around the yard have taken it's toll on them but they are monsters of the glove world. Much better than the pilots green nomex ones I used in Afghanistan. The gloves come pliable and more importantly comfortable right out of the package. Seams hold up well under stress and hard physical labor [like filling sandbags]. Great colors and fit with improved dexterity for the thumb and trigger [index] finger. Buy two pair I did!
customer_reviews.author: Jedi

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome glove. I work for a living and go through a couple pair of these a year. I buy these as needed. However... do not expect touchscreen ability to last more than 2 or 3 weeks if you actually work a real job.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice A. Corbeil

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gloves for paintball
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic gloves for paintball. I took a few hits to the fingers and walked away without any welts or pain. Just what I've been missing on the field. No issues with bulky gloves getting caught up in the trigger guard, and you have great dexterity, so no issues opening ball pods or messing with gear. Nice Velcro on the wrist keeps the gloves snug. If you paintball, you need these.
customer_reviews.author: PA Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: I have had these gloves for close to 4 months now. They have held up fairly well to the abuse i give them. The only knocks that I have on them are the extra protection on the palm has came loose and the wrist straps fasteners are sub par. They never really worked from the beginning. Just wished they would of used velcro brand instead of a cheap knockoff. The reason i bought these were for the knuckle protection and it has held up. So I will probably get another pair when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves. The sizing chart helped me get the correct size. I think these are just getting better and better after being broken in. I've purchased these before and will order more in the future. The pads on the top of the glove help provide protection without getting in the way.
customer_reviews.author: GRB Reviews

customer_reviews.title: More durable offering
customer_reviews.text: I bought these instead of the fast fits this time around. The Mpacts are more durable and more protective, but take a little longer to put on. I'll be getting these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Stinky
customer_reviews.text: These gloves smell like cat piss. It is horrible. Everything you touch ends up smelling like that. Hopefully I can wash it out. I like the gloves....not the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pair of gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these a year ago and I use them for work. I dig and handle a lot of fragmented sharp metal and these have held up pretty good. I like the velcro strap because it keeps dirt from getting into the glove. I still get a little bit, but it is significantly reduced compared to the gloves that have no adjustable wrist strap at all. My older set of these have a few holes in the thumb and pointer finger where the stitching is, but the palm/fingers with the thicker materiel hold up pretty well. Overall, if you are looking for a lightweight glove that will also help keep your hands cool then I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: carson zachreson

customer_reviews.title: Great but a little smelly
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t really had the chance to really test these gloves but from what i can tell and feel they’ll do great, the only thing is like other people have said YES they do have an unusual smell to them but over time i believe it will go away with use
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: VERY QUALITY AND COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with these. I didnt expect such quality gloves. I'm gonna use them for building my small gun projects and shooting. I might just order another pair just for shooting they ar so awesome
customer_reviews.author: Jason samples

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves, don't last long
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these gloves daily at work to deliver mail, and the fingers have started to tear and separate. Only have been using them for about a month, so not worth the money in my opinion. They felt great and comfortable while wearing them, just wish their durability was better.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G Klaysmat

customer_reviews.title: Safety equipment
customer_reviews.text: Safety gloves for my grandson when goes out to the airsoft range. They seem to be comfortable. Can't comment on durability as he hasn't use them for long.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Wrist area needs to be reinforced!
customer_reviews.text: I really love these gloves but they have already started to tear in the palm. This is faster wear than usual but otherwise these gloves are great! Lightweight good ventilation and protection.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Ripped fingers
customer_reviews.text: They are already wearing horribly to the point of nothing in the fingers! These were not intended for heavy lifting or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: Mischelle Felbab

customer_reviews.title: Do not get these if your doing real work!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend not buying these gloves. That are awful. I got half a deck built and they started to fall apart. The quality isn’t worth the money. I had an older pair and they lasted for 3yrs before the started to fall apart. I would say these are equivalent to expensive gardening gloves, not real work gloves. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: OT

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any hand work
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. This is my second pair. First ones last 6 yrs using almost every weekend. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves, would definately recommend
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best gloves I have ever gotten, and I've gotten quite a few over the years. The fit is perfect, they are solidly made, and they feel great. The rubberized part on them is cool, and the padding on the underside is great for if you play paintball or airsoft and you need to get down on your hands and knees to move (i.e. prickers, thorns, and other things you don't want in the palms of your hands). I would recommend these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: These run a little smaller than you would expect
customer_reviews.text: These gloves provide great protection to your hands and have extra padding in key points. I really enjoy wearing them but do note that I'm an average size guy with hands // arms a little on the slender side and i have to struggle to get on a size Large
customer_reviews.author: Ian H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I’ve used them while handling various weapon systems (Mk. 19, M240B, M4, M16, M2) and handled various explosives with them. C4 sticks easy but cleans up decent. They’re super tough and allow for great dexterity and control.
customer_reviews.author: Davin McCloud

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: These are super tough gloves with padded tops. I use them for everything from shooting guns to cutting wood. They have a very strong odor -I'm guessing from the plastic on top so they are not good for deer hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Turkey Reaper

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected, have loved all my Mechanix Wear gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Considering the protection, I was pleased with the feel and flexibility of these gloves. I use it when I'm working outdoors, especially when swinging an axe and similar things when I need good cut protection or protection from prickly leaves/bushes/vines!
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Smell of Marijuana
customer_reviews.text: Well, the fit and function is great. The fact that they wreak of Marijuana is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have used a few times and they have held up to the abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Crystle

customer_reviews.title: Prefect fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy, they're well make and fit my hands just right
customer_reviews.author: Lance Jettie

customer_reviews.title: Great but not a fan of the velcro
customer_reviews.text: Great glove, however I prefer the fast-fit version to this velcro style. The fast fit is more quiet. I tend to pull them off and on frequently, looking at GPS and pushing buttons, phone touches, changes in the sun/shade, walking vs sitting, etc. Having a quiet glove is important to me.
customer_reviews.author: S. C. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & durable
customer_reviews.text: Durable, comfortable gloves. Use in woods for chainsaw work, Tractor work, etc... gloves have held up well—bought a second pair, still using first pair after 2 full years
customer_reviews.author: G Clowers

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I've used these gloves for the past year, mostly for trail biking and firewood work (chain-sawing and stacking). They're comfortable, have held up very well, protect my hands from the odd bump or impact, and look like they have lots of life left in them. I used to get a new pair of leather gloves every year or so, but these are my new favorites
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Long

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Usually a size large but these were slightly too big. But not enough to return them or not use them. They are durable so far and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: The Vegas

customer_reviews.title: 💪
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not water resistant at all but for shooting and other elbow grease tasks these are the gloves to buy, spend the extra money cause you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Omar Bahlool

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves ever.
customer_reviews.text: Own two sets and carry them daily for duty use. Have used them through car wrecks, duty use, NTOA firearms classes, and SWAT school without issues. By far the best working gloves I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: -A-

customer_reviews.title: They were very comfortable while shooting
customer_reviews.text: These fit fairly well and that's saying a lot because I have wide hands. They were very comfortable while shooting, but they did take some getting used to while reloading magazines. Although not perfect, these are the best I have found so far....
customer_reviews.author: JRCCRW

customer_reviews.title: Awesome just buy them.
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. Not for super cold weather or water. I’d use them anywhere above freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger1-6

customer_reviews.title: Awesome glove!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! This is the second pair I have purchased for my husband. It's all he we wears! They do seem to wear more quickly than expected, but for the price you can't beat them!
customer_reviews.author: abutler

customer_reviews.title: i so bad want to mark a 5 the most gad ass ...
customer_reviews.text: i so bad want to mark a 5 the most gad ass looking and padded where needed gloves ive ever had id like to rekindle this review with a revisit with all id like to say and tihis is my only way to contact you i got a issue with the stitching
customer_reviews.author: Eric Route

customer_reviews.title: Good solid gloves
customer_reviews.text: I got these gloves for handling K9s on leash, and it does a great job. I like the feel of them, and they stay out of the way while still doing a good job protecting. Only disadvantage is no using touch-screens while the gloves are on, but that's perfectly OK!
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Good work glove
customer_reviews.text: Durable, working in scrapyard and this provides the protection needed but not too hot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crazy strong incense/ pot smell
customer_reviews.text: After letting them air out for 2 months they are still unusable because of an insanely strong incense/ pot smell they came with. I have had 20 pair of this style glove in the past and only the three I ordered from here smell this way.
customer_reviews.author: YPN

customer_reviews.title: Had Higher Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Did not meet expectations. The smell of plastic chemicals is nauseating.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Campagna

customer_reviews.title: The rubberized backing is great for bumping into stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand and have owned several pairs. This was the first time getting the thicker padded versions anf they're are holding up great to daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmeh Dean

customer_reviews.title: Best glove feel to the hand. Don’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: They don’t last long. But definitely have the best feel of a glove that I’ve ever used. I’d say if you get a couple weeks use, you got your money’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: larry b

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper materials
customer_reviews.text: I wore a hole through the middle finger of these gloves in about 2 weeks of use. I've had multiple pair prior. Seems like this pair was made with much cheaper materials.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, less dexterity.
customer_reviews.text: Well made product, but dexterity is VERY limited. Before I wrote the review, I used them a dozen or so times, hoping they would loosen up or break in. Fit was perfect, just don’t expect surgical precision from the finger tips.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Somehow damaged when I got them.
customer_reviews.text: The right glove as you can see has a hole on the back side. I only took these out of the box a few hours ago. They fit nice and feel grippy but i feel like that hole will widen over time.
customer_reviews.author: Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: Avoid these for touch screen and stink
customer_reviews.text: Unwearable these gloves smell bad like burnt plastic..... also bought them for touch uses and it doesn’t work..... Avoid these at all cost.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Tough gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are really good. Worked out in them for 5 months now and put them in the wash machine twice and no problem. Didn't put them in the dryer though
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Took these on a missions trip to Mexico where we were building houses. Survived concrete and stucco mixing, framing, scorching hot temperatures, getting dipped in water, and everything else that I threw at it. Most of our crew had blisters on their hands and mine were perfectly fine. Love these gloves. They look super cool and are incredibly functional. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: rjtproductions

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Pretty durable. Am a carpenter and they are my fav gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Size L.... XXL Size Thumb
customer_reviews.text: The fit of the glove was perfect all except the thumb... The thumb had so much excess I could bend both thumb tips to the third Grip line.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and design features
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and design features, yet I find that a Large selection is a bit low cut around the wrist even though it fits the palm and fingers well. Shipping was excellent as always.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAELCOLEMAN

customer_reviews.title: WARRANTY PERIOD IS TOO SHORT
customer_reviews.text: Excessive use with these gloves and they start ripping in the fingers. They are comfortable, grip is good but if you using a lot of ratchet straps and handling chains they will not last very long. For that price the warrant should be longer. I tried returning mine because after only less than 2 months they were no longer serviceable.
customer_reviews.author: KENNETH R.HOLMES

customer_reviews.title: More for your money.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent gloves. I've seen Oakley's and other name brand gloves go for like $60-80. They aren't anywhere close to these classic Mechanix Wear Gloves. Excellent padding, great fit and at a decent price. Only real drawback is that they are a tad bright in the green. Nothing a little mud and grime won't fix when you use them though.
customer_reviews.author: M1

customer_reviews.title: Good fit.
customer_reviews.text: They fit well. Keeps the hands safer than ye old leather work gloves or jerseys.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth!!
customer_reviews.text: A little stiff at first but very comfortable. I use these for work and for shooting. Also keeps hands warm till about 20 degree’s. I plan on buying another pair to use for other things!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian S.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic tactical gloves. I use these in all my firearms training classes and they hold up great! Going to order more!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for my uses
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves as mountain bike gloves. I've been using them for all kinds of things now and had to pick up another pair locally. So far durability has been good. Fit is good as well. Wore them moose hunting Labor Day weekend while on the four wheeler. They provide ample grip and enough cushion that the ride in and out of the back country was alright. Will update if anything funky happens with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Duchess

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise they grip well and have great padding on the back of the hands as well ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for mountain biking. Lots of little thread ends that I had to clean up myself. Otherwise they grip well and have great padding on the back of the hands as well as decent pads on the palms.
customer_reviews.author: Bjorn

customer_reviews.title: Great Shooter's Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves for shooting. They are tough but soft, and the padded palms are great for cushioning recoil. The armored finger protection makes them ideal for field tactical use. The wash very well when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Lindsey --- Central Valley, CA

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for all missions
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly, is very tough but comfortable and can do many different tasks easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rance Walleston

customer_reviews.title: ... numerous training exercises in the Army and they look great and hold up very well
customer_reviews.text: I've used these gloves for numerous training exercises in the Army and they look great and hold up very well. Many of my platoon-mates have also bought these after seeing how great they are.
customer_reviews.author: steveo

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work perfectly for doing construction, yard work, and mechanical work. They are very comfortable and flexible while also offering good protection. This is my second pair after using the first pair for several years. The best work gloves I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: |J|

customer_reviews.title: Sucks cause the 7 dollar Menards gloves hold together better
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fell apart within the first couple weeks, I noticed they were already tearing. Sucks cause the 7 dollar Menards gloves hold together better.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle C.

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves. Idk what SOME people talking about their quality like mine came out nice as anything & durable. Might be just theirs. Anyways I’ve used them for cutting trees & for hunting & I’ve had no problem.
customer_reviews.author: s

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, looks great
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, looks great, and provides nice protection from airsoft BBs. I'd definitely recommend them. My only issue is that the purple on the rubber part doesn't fit with the multicam pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Run true to the size chart or a hair big (measure and use the chart)
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ray Oaks

customer_reviews.title: They're just okay
customer_reviews.text: They're gloves. They're tough. But it also says you can use them with your phone. Nope! That's a fat lie.
customer_reviews.author: Rolan Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend buying. Mine have gone through yardwork
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are tuff. They protect really well and still have a lot of mobility. They aren't too hot for the summer heat. Would recommend buying. Mine have gone through yardwork, countless hours of sword fighting and airsoft and they are still holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: ViciousBlood

customer_reviews.title: OCP gloves for ROTC training
customer_reviews.text: Sizing guide is a bit off, I would recommend size M unless your hands are massive. The gloves themselves are very comfortable and hold up to a beating out in the field. I love the loops being able to hang them on the FLC and they look great with the OCP uniform.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Fairbanks

product_meta.title: Mechanix Wear - MultiCam M-Pact Tactical Gloves (Large, Camouflage)
product_meta.description: Blend in. The M-Pact with MultiCam transitional camouflage features a Thermoplastic Rubber (TPR) knuckle guard and dedicated finger guards to reduce impact and abrasion injuries in the field. The dual-layer internal fingertip construction reinforces the thumb and index finger for improved abrasion resistance, while the embossed fingertip pattern improves feel and overall dexterity. D3O palm padding absorbs and dissipates high-impact energy through the palm when you’re fully engaged so you can maintain your focus.
feature_bullets: Thermoplastic Rubber (TPR) knuckle guard and finger guards protect against impact.
Form-fitting TrekDry with MultiCam camouflage helps keep your hands cool and comfortable.
Dual-layer internal fingertip reinforcement provides added durability.
D3O palm padding absorbs and dissipates high-impact energy through the palm.
